title: System Information Discovery
descrption: An adversary may attempt to get detailed information about the operating system and hardware, including version, patches, hotfixes, service packs, and architecture. Adversaries may use the information from System Information Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.WindowsExample commands and utilities that obtain this information include ver, Systeminfo, and dir within cmd for identifying information based on present files and directories.MacOn Mac, the systemsetup command gives a detailed breakdown of the system, but it requires administrative privileges. Additionally, the system_profiler gives a very detailed breakdown of configurations, firewall rules, mounted volumes, hardware, and many other things without needing elevated permissions.AWSIn Amazon Web Services (AWS), the Application Discovery Service may be used by an adversary to identify servers, virtual machines, software, and software dependencies running.[1]GCPOn Google Cloud Platform (GCP) GET /v1beta1/{{parent=organizations/}}/assets or POST /v1beta1/{{parent=organizations/
Platform: Linux, macOS, Windows, AWS, GCP, Azure
Data Sources: Azure activity logs, Stackdriver logs, AWS CloudTrail logs, Process monitoring, Process command-line parameters

related.Name: 4H RAT
related.Description: 4H RAT sends an OS version identifier in its beacons.[16]

related.Name: admin@338
related.Description: admin@338 actors used the following commands after exploiting a machine with LOWBALL malware to obtain information about the OS: ver >> %temp%\download systeminfo >> %temp%\download[102]

related.Name: ADVSTORESHELL
related.Description: ADVSTORESHELL can run Systeminfo to gather information about the victim.[49][50]

related.Name: Agent Tesla
related.Description: Agent Tesla collects the system's computer name and also has the capability to collect information on the processor, memory, and video card from the system.[134][135]

related.Name: APT18
related.Description: APT18 can collect system information from the victim’s machine.[186]

related.Name: APT19
related.Description: APT19 collected system architecture information. APT19 used an HTTP malware variant and a Port 22 malware variant to gather the hostname and CPU information from the victim’s machine.[167][168]

related.Name: APT3
related.Description: APT3 has a tool that can obtain information about the local system.[123][177]

related.Name: APT32
related.Description: APT32 has collected the OS version and computer name from victims. One of the group's backdoors can also query the Windows Registry to gather system information, and another macOS backdoor performs a fingerprint of the machine on its first connection to the C&C server.[174][175][176]

related.Name: APT37
related.Description: APT37 collects the computer name, the BIOS model, and execution path.[163]

related.Name: Astaroth
related.Description: Astaroth collects the machine name and keyboard language from the system.[136][137]

related.Name: Azorult
related.Description: Azorult can collect the machine information, system architecture, the OS version, computer name, Windows product name, the number of CPU cores, video card information, and the system language.[93][94]

related.Name: BabyShark
related.Description: BabyShark has executed the ver command. [158]

related.Name: Backdoor.Oldrea
related.Description: Backdoor.Oldrea collects information about the OS and computer name.[127]

related.Name: BACKSPACE
related.Description: During its initial execution, BACKSPACE extracts operating system information from the infected host.[62]

related.Name: BADCALL
related.Description: BADCALL collects the computer name and host name on the compromised system.[124]

related.Name: BadPatch
related.Description: BadPatch collects the OS system, OS version, MAC address, and the computer name from the victim’s machine.[121]

related.Name: Bankshot
related.Description: Bankshot gathers system information, network addresses, disk type, disk free space, and the operation system version.[114][115]

related.Name: BISCUIT
related.Description: BISCUIT has a command to collect the processor type, operation system, computer name, uptime, and whether the system is a laptop or PC.[92]

related.Name: Bisonal
related.Description: Bisonal has a command to gather system information from the victim’s machine.[83]

related.Name: BlackEnergy
related.Description: BlackEnergy has used Systeminfo to gather the OS version, as well as information on the system configuration, BIOS, the motherboard, and the processor.[36][37]

related.Name: Brave Prince
related.Description: Brave Prince collects hard drive content and system configuration information.[74]

related.Name: BUBBLEWRAP
related.Description: BUBBLEWRAP collects system information, including the operating system version and hostname.[102]

related.Name: Cannon
related.Description: Cannon can gather system information from the victim’s machine such as the OS version, machine name, and drive information.[40][42]

related.Name: Cardinal RAT
related.Description: Cardinal RAT can collect the hostname, Microsoft Windows version, and processor architecture from a victim machine.[35]

related.Name: ChChes
related.Description: ChChes collects the victim hostname, window resolution, and Microsoft Windows version.[51][52]

related.Name: cmd
related.Description: cmd can be used to find information about the operating system.[7]

related.Name: Comnie
related.Description: Comnie collects the hostname of the victim machine.[101]

related.Name: CORESHELL
related.Description: CORESHELL collects hostname, volume serial number and OS version data from the victim and sends the information to its C2 server.[54]

related.Name: CozyCar
related.Description: A system info module in CozyCar gathers information on the victim host’s configuration.[118]

related.Name: Crimson
related.Description: Crimson contains a command to collect the victim PC name and operating system.[12]

related.Name: DarkComet
related.Description: DarkComet can collect the computer name, RAM used, and operating system version from the victim’s machine.[33][34]

related.Name: Darkhotel
related.Description: Darkhotel has collected the hostname, OS version, service pack version, and the processor architecture from the victim’s machine.[179]

related.Name: Denis
related.Description: Denis collects OS information and the computer name from the victim’s machine.[104][105]

related.Name: Derusbi
related.Description: Derusbi gathers the name of the local host, version of GNU Compiler Collection (GCC), and the system information about the CPU, machine, and operating system.[125]

related.Name: DownPaper
related.Description: DownPaper collects the victim host name and serial number, and then sends the information to the C2 server.[132]

related.Name: DustySky
related.Description: DustySky extracts basic information about the operating system.[77]

related.Name: Elise
related.Description: Elise executes systeminfo after initial communication is made to the remote server.[59]

related.Name: Emissary
related.Description: Emissary has the capability to execute ver, systeminfo, and gpresult commands.[64]

related.Name: Empire
related.Description: Empire can enumerate host system information like OS, architecture, applied patches, and more.[8]

related.Name: Epic
related.Description: Epic collects the OS version, hardware information, computer name, available system memory status, disk space information, and system and user language settings.[128]

related.Name: FALLCHILL
related.Description: FALLCHILL can collect operating system (OS) version information, processor information, system name, and information about installed disks from the victim.[38]

related.Name: Felismus
related.Description: Felismus collects the system information, including hostname and OS version, and sends it to the C2 server.[103]

related.Name: FELIXROOT
related.Description: FELIXROOT collects the victim’s computer name, processor architecture, OS version, volume serial number, and system type.[81][82]

related.Name: Final1stspy
related.Description: Final1stspy obtains victim Microsoft Windows version information and CPU architecture.[22]

related.Name: FinFisher
related.Description: FinFisher checks if the victim OS is 32 or 64-bit.[86][87]

related.Name: FlawedAmmyy
related.Description: FlawedAmmyy beacons out the victim operating system and computer name during the initial infection.[143]

related.Name: Fysbis
related.Description: Fysbis has used the command ls /etc | egrep -e"fedora*|debian*|gentoo*|mandriva*|mandrake*|meego*|redhat*|lsb-*|sun-*|SUSE*|release" to determine which Linux OS version is running.[156]

related.Name: Gamaredon Group
related.Description: A Gamaredon Group file stealer can gather the victim's computer name and drive serial numbers to send to a C2 server.[164]

related.Name: Gold Dragon
related.Description: Gold Dragon collects endpoint information using the systeminfo command.[74]

related.Name: GravityRAT
related.Description: GravityRAT collects the MAC address, computer name, and CPU information.[120]

related.Name: GRIFFON
related.Description: GRIFFON has used a reconnaissance module that can be used to retrieve information about a victim's computer, including the resolution of the workstation .[159]

related.Name: HALFBAKED
related.Description: HALFBAKED can obtain information about the OS, processor, and BIOS.[60]

related.Name: HAPPYWORK
related.Description: can collect system information, including computer name, system manufacturer, IsDebuggerPresent state, and execution path.[45]

related.Name: HAWKBALL
related.Description: HAWKBALL can collect the OS version, architecture information, and computer name.[152]

related.Name: Honeybee
related.Description: Honeybee gathers computer name and information using the systeminfo command.[165]

related.Name: HOPLIGHT
related.Description: HOPLIGHT has been observed collecting victim machine information like OS version, drivers, volume information and more.[139]

related.Name: Hydraq
related.Description: Hydraq creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can retrieve information such as computer name, OS version, processor speed, memory size, and CPU speed.[85]

related.Name: InnaputRAT
related.Description: InnaputRAT gathers volume drive information and system information.[23]

related.Name: InvisiMole
related.Description: InvisiMole can gather information on the mapped drives, OS version, computer name, and memory size.[67]

related.Name: Ixeshe
related.Description: Ixeshe collects the computer name of the victim's system during the initial infection.[147]

related.Name: JHUHUGIT
related.Description: JHUHUGIT obtains a build identifier as well as victim hard drive information from Windows registry key HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Disk\Enum. Another JHUHUGIT variant gathers the victim storage volume serial number and the storage device name.[27][28]

related.Name: JPIN
related.Description: JPIN can obtain system information such as OS version and disk space.[10]

related.Name: jRAT
related.Description: jRAT collects information about the OS (version, build type, install date) as well as system up-time upon receiving a connection from a backdoor.[140]

related.Name: KARAE
related.Description: KARAE can collect system information.[45]

related.Name: Kasidet
related.Description: Kasidet has the ability to obtain a victim's system name and operating system version.[111]

related.Name: Kazuar
related.Description: Kazuar gathers information on the system and local drives.[61]

related.Name: Ke3chang
related.Description: Ke3chang performs operating system information discovery using systeminfo.[161][162]

related.Name: KeyBoy
related.Description: KeyBoy can gather extended system information, such as information about the operating system, disks, and memory.[149][150]

related.Name: KEYMARBLE
related.Description: KEYMARBLE has the capability to collect the computer name, language settings, the OS version, CPU information, disk devices, and time elapsed since system start.[109]

related.Name: Kimsuky
related.Description: Kimsuky has gathered information about the infected computer.[187]

related.Name: KOMPROGO
related.Description: KOMPROGO is capable of retrieving information about the infected system.[55]

related.Name: KONNI
related.Description: KONNI can gather the OS version, architecture information, connected drives, hostname, and computer name from the victim’s machine.[131]

related.Name: Kwampirs
related.Description: Kwampirs collects OS version information such as registered owner details, manufacturer details, processor type, available storage, installed patches, hostname, version info, system date, and other system information by using the commands systeminfo, net config workstation, hostname, ver, set, and date /t.[57]

related.Name: Lazarus Group
related.Description: Several Lazarus Group malware families collect information on the type and version of the victim OS, as well as the victim computer name and CPU information. A Destover-like variant used by Lazarus Group also collects disk space information and sends it to its C2 server.[182][183][184][185][70]

related.Name: LightNeuron
related.Description: LightNeuron gathers the victim computer name using the Win32 API call GetComputerName.[153]

related.Name: Linfo
related.Description: Linfo creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can retrieve system information.[29]

related.Name: Machete
related.Description: Machete collects the hostname of the target computer. [155]

related.Name: Magic Hound
related.Description: Magic Hound malware has used a PowerShell command to check the victim system architecture to determine if it is an x64 machine. Other malware has obtained the OS version, UUID, and computer/host name to send to the C2 server.[172]

related.Name: Micropsia
related.Description: Micropsia gathers the hostname and OS version from the victim’s machine.[90][91]

related.Name: MirageFox
related.Description: MirageFox can collect CPU and architecture information from the victim’s machine.[15]

related.Name: Mis-Type
related.Description: The initial beacon packet for Mis-Type contains the operating system version and file system of the victim.[20]

related.Name: Misdat
related.Description: The initial beacon packet for Misdat contains the operating system version of the victim.[20]

related.Name: MobileOrder
related.Description: MobileOrder has a command to upload to its C2 server victim mobile device information, including IMEI, IMSI, SIM card serial number, phone number, Android version, and other information.[14]

related.Name: MoonWind
related.Description: MoonWind can obtain the victim hostname, Windows version, RAM amount, number of drives, and screen resolution.[110]

related.Name: More_eggs
related.Description: More_eggs has the capability to gather the OS version and computer name.[99][100]

related.Name: MuddyWater
related.Description: MuddyWater has used malware that can collect the victim’s OS version and machine name.[180][181]

related.Name: MURKYTOP
related.Description: MURKYTOP has the capability to retrieve information about the OS.[56]

related.Name: Naid
related.Description: Naid collects a unique identifier (UID) from a compromised host.[11]

related.Name: NanHaiShu
related.Description: NanHaiShu can gather the victim computer name and serial number.[25]

related.Name: NavRAT
related.Description: NavRAT uses systeminfo on a victim’s machine.[116]

related.Name: NDiskMonitor
related.Description: NDiskMonitor obtains the victim computer name and encrypts the information to send over its C2 channel.[119]

related.Name: NETWIRE
related.Description: NETWIRE can discover and collect victim system information.[96]

related.Name: njRAT
related.Description: njRAT enumerates the victim operating system and computer name during the initial infection.[145]

related.Name: NOKKI
related.Description: NOKKI can gather information on drives and the operating system on the victim’s machine.[89]

related.Name: OceanSalt
related.Description: OceanSalt can collect the computer name from the system.[107]

related.Name: Octopus
related.Description: Octopus collects system drive information, the computer name, and the size of the disk.[84]

related.Name: OilRig
related.Description: OilRig has run hostname and systeminfo on a victim.  [169][170][171]

related.Name: OopsIE
related.Description: OopsIE checks for information on the CPU fan, temperature, mouse, hard disk, and motherboard as part of its anti-VM checks.[21]

related.Name: Orz
related.Description: Orz can gather the victim OS version and whether it is 64 or 32 bit.[25]

related.Name: OSInfo
related.Description: OSInfo discovers information about the infected machine.[123]

related.Name: OSX/Shlayer
related.Description: OSX/Shlayer can collect the macOS version and IOPlatformUUID.[154]

related.Name: OSX_OCEANLOTUS.D
related.Description: OSX_OCEANLOTUS.D collects the MAC address, computer name, hardware UUID, serial number, and operating system version.[130]

related.Name: Pasam
related.Description: Pasam creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can retrieve information such as hostname and free disk space.[122]

related.Name: Patchwork
related.Description: Patchwork collected the victim computer name, OS version, and architecture type and sent the information to its C2 server. Patchwork also enumerated all available drives on the victim's machine.[160][119]

related.Name: PinchDuke
related.Description: PinchDuke gathers system configuration information.[58]

related.Name: Pisloader
related.Description: Pisloader has a command to collect victim system information, including the system name and OS version.[98]

related.Name: PLAINTEE
related.Description: PLAINTEE collects general system enumeration data about the infected machine and checks the OS version.[108]

related.Name: POORAIM
related.Description: POORAIM can identify system information, including battery status.[45]

related.Name: PoshC2
related.Description: PoshC2 contains modules, such as Get-ComputerInfo, for enumerating common system information.[9]

related.Name: PowerDuke
related.Description: PowerDuke has commands to get information about the victim's name, build, version, serial number, and memory usage.[13]

related.Name: POWERSTATS
related.Description: POWERSTATS can retrieve OS name/architecture and computer/domain name information from compromised hosts.[66]

related.Name: POWRUNER
related.Description: POWRUNER may collect information about the system by running hostname and systeminfo on a victim.[126]

related.Name: Prikormka
related.Description: A module in Prikormka collects information from the victim about Windows OS version, computer name, battery info, and physical memory.[113]

related.Name: Proxysvc
related.Description: Proxysvc collects the OS version, country name, MAC address, computer name, physical memory statistics, and volume information for all drives on the system.[70]

related.Name: PUNCHBUGGY
related.Description: PUNCHBUGGY can gather system information such as computer names. [148]

related.Name: Pupy
related.Description: Pupy can grab a system’s information including the OS version, architecture, etc.[5]

related.Name: QuasarRAT
related.Description: QuasarRAT has a command to gather system information from the victim’s machine.[4]

related.Name: RATANKBA
related.Description: RATANKBA gathers information about the OS architecture, OS name, and OS version/Service pack.[75][76]

related.Name: Reaver
related.Description: Reaver collects system information from the victim, including CPU speed, computer name, volume serial number, ANSI code page, OEM code page identifier for the OS, Microsoft Windows version, and memory information.[112]

related.Name: RedLeaves
related.Description: RedLeaves can gather extended system information including the hostname, OS version number, platform, memory information, time elapsed since system startup, and CPU information.[52][53]

related.Name: Remsec
related.Description: Remsec can obtain the OS version information, computer name, processor architecture, machine role, and OS edition.[17]

related.Name: Revenge RAT
related.Description: Revenge RAT collects the CPU information, OS information, and system language.[141]

related.Name: RogueRobin
related.Description: RogueRobin gathers BIOS versions and manufacturers, the number of CPU cores, the total physical memory, and the computer name.[79]

related.Name: ROKRAT
related.Description: ROKRAT gathers the computer name and checks the OS version to ensure it doesn’t run on a Windows XP or Windows Server 2003 systems.[46][47][48]

related.Name: RTM
related.Description: RTM can obtain the computer name, OS version, and default language identifier.[63]

related.Name: RunningRAT
related.Description: RunningRAT gathers the OS version, logical drives information, processor information, and volume information.[74]

related.Name: S-Type
related.Description: The initial beacon packet for S-Type contains the operating system version and file system of the victim.[20]

related.Name: ServHelper
related.Description: ServHelper will attempt to enumerate Windows version and system architecture.[144]

related.Name: Shamoon
related.Description: Shamoon obtains the victim's operating system version and keyboard layout and sends the information to the C2 server.[26]

related.Name: SHUTTERSPEED
related.Description: SHUTTERSPEED can collect system information.[45]

related.Name: SLOWDRIFT
related.Description: SLOWDRIFT collects and sends system information to its C2.[45]

related.Name: SOUNDBITE
related.Description: SOUNDBITE is capable of gathering system information.[55]

related.Name: Sowbug
related.Description: Sowbug obtained OS version and hardware configuration from a victim.[178]

related.Name: SpeakUp
related.Description: SpeakUp uses the cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep -c "cpu family" 2>&1 command to gather system information.[138]

related.Name: SslMM
related.Description: SslMM sends information to its hard-coded C2, including OS version, service pack information, processor speed, system name, and OS install date.[19]

related.Name: Stealth Falcon
related.Description: Stealth Falcon malware gathers system information via WMI, including the system directory, build number, serial number, version, manufacturer, model, and total physical memory.[166]

related.Name: StoneDrill
related.Description: StoneDrill has the capability to discover the system OS, Windows version, architecture and environment.  [142]

related.Name: StreamEx
related.Description: StreamEx has the ability to enumerate system information.[80]

related.Name: SynAck
related.Description: SynAck gathers computer names, OS version info, and also checks installed keyboard layouts to estimate if it has been launched from a certain list of countries.[88]

related.Name: Sys10
related.Description: Sys10 collects the computer name, OS versioning information, and OS install date and sends the information to the C2.[19]

related.Name: Systeminfo
related.Description: Systeminfo can be used to gather information about the operating system.[6]

related.Name: T9000
related.Description: T9000 gathers and beacons the operating system build number and CPU Architecture (32-bit/64-bit) during installation.[133]

related.Name: TrickBot
related.Description: TrickBot gathers the OS version, CPU type, amount of RAM available from the victim’s machine.[68][69]

related.Name: Tropic Trooper
related.Description: Tropic Trooper has detected a target system’s OS version.[151]

related.Name: Turla
related.Description: Turla surveys a system upon check-in to discover operating system configuration details using the systeminfo and set commands.[173]

related.Name: TURNEDUP
related.Description: TURNEDUP is capable of gathering system information.[117]

related.Name: TYPEFRAME
related.Description: TYPEFRAME can gather the disk volume information.[24]

related.Name: Unknown Logger
related.Description: Unknown Logger can obtain information about the victim computer name, physical memory, country, and date.[106]

related.Name: UPPERCUT
related.Description: UPPERCUT has the capability to gather the system’s hostname and OS version.[97]

related.Name: Ursnif
related.Description: Ursnif has used Systeminfo to gather system information.[146]

related.Name: VERMIN
related.Description: VERMIN collects the OS name, machine name, and architecture information.[78]

related.Name: Volgmer
related.Description: Volgmer can gather system information, the computer name, OS version, drive and serial information from the victim's machine.[71][72][73]

related.Name: WINDSHIELD
related.Description: WINDSHIELD can gather the victim computer name.[55]

related.Name: WINERACK
related.Description: WINERACK can gather information about the host.[45]

related.Name: Wingbird
related.Description: Wingbird checks the victim OS version after executing to determine where to drop files based on whether the victim is 32-bit or 64-bit.[129]

related.Name: WinMM
related.Description: WinMM collects the system name, OS version including service pack, and system install date and sends the information to the C2 server.[19]

related.Name: XAgentOSX
related.Description: XAgentOSX contains the getInstalledAPP function to run ls -la /Applications to gather what applications are installed.[65]

related.Name: Yahoyah
related.Description: Yahoyah checks for the system’s Windows OS version and hostname.[151]

related.Name: yty
related.Description: yty gathers the computer name, the serial number of the main disk volume, CPU information, Microsoft Windows version, and runs the command systeminfo.[30]

related.Name: Zebrocy
related.Description: Zebrocy collects the OS version, computer name and serial number for the storage volume C:. Zebrocy also runs the systeminfo command to gather system information.[39][40][41][42][43][44]

related.Name: ZeroT
related.Description: ZeroT gathers the victim's computer name, Windows version, and system language, and then sends it to its C2 server.[18]

related.Name: Zeus Panda
related.Description: Zeus Panda collects the OS version, system architecture, computer name, product ID, install date, and information on the keyboard mapping to determine the language used on the system.[31][32]

related.Name: ZLib
related.Description: ZLib has the ability to enumerate system information.[20]

related.Name: zwShell
related.Description: zwShell can obtain the victim PC name and OS version.[95]

related.Name: ZxShell
related.Description: ZxShell can collect the local hostname, operating system details, CPU speed, and total physical memory. [157]
